page.title: 18FARMING IN FILKINS AREA
page.content: 4 farms were visited within the area - one of these is owner-farmed, one leas- ed from owner and 2 are managed for owner. Sizes vary from 120 to 1500 acres. All considered themselves to be mixed farmers. They grow winter and spring barley, wheat, oil seed rape, oats, peas, turnips, fodder beet and tricale- a rye/wheat grain for dry lands. Grass is grown for both perman- ent pasture and grass leys and there is some rough pasture and sanfoin. A small area is woodland. Stock is kept in very different ways at different farms. One farmer farms an intensive pig unit with l,000 pigs, raising bacon stock in 5 months, whilst another keeps 45 free range pigs, mar- keting at 4 months. In the first case, the pigs are fed partly on bought-in food while the free range pigs are fed on home-raised grain and peas
